Interface com.chimu.form.database.DatabaseConnection

public interface DatabaseConnection
A DatabaseConnection represents both a connection to a specific database. This includes knowing the driver type, product type, database scheme, and the current state of that database.

The primary important protocol for FORM clients is the #table method which provides the ability to get table connections that can be used in mapping to the database.

Method Index

connection()
Return the JDBC Connection used with this DatabaseConnection
databaseProduct()
Return the type of database product this connection is connected to
defaultTransactionIsolationLevel()
The default TransactionIsolationLevel for the database
doneSetup()
newTable(String)
Get a new TableConnection from the DatabaseConnection, even if a TableConnection already exists.
newTransactionCoordinator()
Creates a new TransactionCoordinator even if one currently exists.
setColumnJavaTypes()
Go through all tables in this connection and set the java column types for them based on the SQL Data types.
setupEnablePerformanceFeatures()
Enabling performance features will turn on optimizations that can make database performance faster.

Methods

setupTraceStream 
 public abstract void setupTraceStream(PrintWriter traceStream)
setupTraceStream_traceLevel 
 public abstract void setupTraceStream_traceLevel(PrintWriter traceStream,
                                                  int traceLevel)
setupEnablePerformanceFeatures 
 public abstract void setupEnablePerformanceFeatures()
Enabling performance features will turn on optimizations that can make database performance faster. You should only enable this when you are sure the application is stable and want to see if you can improve the database layer. Features that are known not to work with a particular database or JDBC driver will not be turned on, but compatibility problems can still exist.

table 
 public abstract Table table(String tableName)
Get a Table from the DatabaseConnection. If a Table already exists, this will return it.
